chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall a b x y : Z, gcdZ a b = IZ -> {z : Z | congruentZ z x a /\ congruentZ z y b}

congruentZ = fun x y n : Z => divide Z IdZ multZ OZ n (addZ x (oppZ y)) : Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop

Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
IZ = pos 0 : Z
is_gcdZ_sind : forall P : Z -> Z -> Z -> SProp, (forall b : Z, P OZ b (absZ b)) -> (forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> P r b d -> P b a d) -> forall z z0 z1 : Z, is_gcdZ z z0 z1 -> P z z0 z1
is_gcdZ_ind : forall P : Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop, (forall b : Z, P OZ b (absZ b)) -> (forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> P r b d -> P b a d) -> forall z z0 z1 : Z, is_gcdZ z z0 z1 -> P z z0 z1
gcd_modZ : forall a b q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> gcdZ r b = gcdZ b a

gcdZ_i : forall a b x : Z, is_gcdZ a b x -> {x : Z | is_gcdZ a b x}

Bezout_i : forall a b u v : Z, addZ (multZ a u) (multZ b v) = gcdZ a b -> verify_BezoutZ a b
Inductive verify_BezoutZ (a b : Z) : Set := Bezout_i : forall u v : Z, addZ (multZ a u) (multZ b v) = gcdZ a b -> verify_BezoutZ a b
is_diveuclZ = fun a b q r : Z => b <> OZ /\ leZ OZ r /\ ltZ r (absZ b) /\ a = addZ (multZ b q) r : Z -> Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop
Inductive is_gcdZ : Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop := gcd_OZ : forall b : Z, is_gcdZ OZ b (absZ b) | gcd_mod : forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> is_gcdZ b a d

gcdZ_exists : forall a b : Z, have_gcdZ a b
gcdZ_correct : forall a b : Z, is_gcdZ a b (gcdZ a b)
positive_is_gcdZ : forall a b d : Z, is_gcdZ a b d -> leZ OZ d
inversibleZ : forall x : Z, inversible Z multZ IZ x -> x = IZ \/ x = oppZ IZ
diveucl_rec : forall (a b : nat) (P : diveucl a b -> Set), (forall (q r : nat) (g : b > r) (e : a = q * b + r), P (divex a b q r g e)) -> forall d : diveucl a b, P d
Inductive diveuclZ (a b : Z) : Set := divexZ : forall q r : Z, is_diveuclZ a b q r -> diveuclZ a b
addZ_commutativity = fun x y : Z => Z_ind (fun x0 : Z => addZ x0 y = addZ y x0) (eq_sym (add_OZ y)) (fun n : nat => nat_ind (fun n0 : nat => addZ (pos n0) y = addZ y (pos n0)) (eq_sym (add_IZ_succZ y)) (fun (n0 : nat) (H : addZ (pos n0) y = addZ y (pos n0)) => eq_ind_r (fun z : Z => z = addZ y (pos (S n0))) (eq_ind_r (fun z : Z => succZ z = addZ y (pos (S n0))) (let H0 : succZ (pos n0) = pos (S n0) := eq_refl in (fun H1 : succZ (pos n0) = pos (S n0) => eq_ind (succZ (pos n0)) (fun z : Z => succZ (addZ y (pos n0)) = addZ y z) (eq_ind_r (fun z :...
Zbool.Z_noteq_bool : forall x y : BinNums.Z, {b : bool | if b then x <> y else x = y}
Zbool.Z_eq_bool : forall x y : BinNums.Z, {b : bool | if b then x = y else x <> y}
integrityZ = fun a b : Z => Z_rec (fun a0 : Z => multZ a0 b = OZ -> {a0 = OZ} + {b = OZ}) (fun _ : multZ OZ b = OZ => left eq_refl) (fun (n : nat) (H : multZ (pos n) b = OZ) => right (tech_integ_posZ n b H)) (fun (n : nat) (H : multZ (neg n) b = OZ) => right (tech_integ_negZ n b H)) a : integrity Z multZ OZ
Inductive diveucl (a b : nat) : Set := divex : forall q r : nat, b > r -> a = q * b + r -> diveucl a b Arguments diveucl (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments divex (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
Z_rec : forall P : Z -> Set, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_ind : forall P : Z -> Prop, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
le_opp_OZ2 : forall x y : Z, x = oppZ y -> leZ OZ x -> leZ OZ y -> x = y

```coq
intros a b x y H.
exists (addZ x (multZ a (divZ (oppZ y) (gcdZ a b)))).
split.
- unfold congruentZ. exists (divZ (oppZ y) (gcdZ a b)).
  split.
  + apply divide_refl.
  + rewrite <- mult_assoc, mult_comm, <- mult_assoc.
    rewrite (mult_comm a), <- (mult_assoc (divZ (oppZ y) (gcdZ a b))).
    rewrite div_mult, mult_comm, mult_IZ, sub_cancel, mult_comm.
    apply divide_mult.
- unfold congruentZ. exists (divZ (oppZ y) (gcdZ a b)).
  split.
  + apply divide_refl.
  + rewrite <- mult_assoc, mult_comm, <- mult_assoc.
    rewrite (mult_comm b), <- (mult_assoc (divZ (oppZ y) (gcdZ a b))).
    rewrite div_mult, mult_comm, mult_IZ, sub_cancel, mult_comm.
    apply divide_mult.
Qed.
```
